title: Analysing Bioconductor
text: First Bioconductor releases didn’t many packages; example, Bioconductor 1.8 172 packages. Now (January 2025), number packages 2000, 1/10th CRAN contains.
code: wood_bioc_packages() |>   # There isn't enough space to list 2000+ packages.   print(max = 15) #>  [1] "a4"          "a4Base"      "a4Classif"   "a4Core"      "a4Preproc"   #>  [6] "a4Reporting" "ABarray"     "abseqR"      "ABSSeq"      "acde"        #> [11] "ACE"         "aCGH"        "ACME"        "ADaCGH2"     "ADAM"        #>  [ reached getOption("max.print") -- omitted 2216 entries ]

title: Analysing Bioconductor
text: mentioned earlier, Bioconductor release single package version associated . check version supported Bioconductor release user use wood_bioc_version().

title: Analysing Bioconductor
text: list package dependencies user use wood_bioc_dependencies(). function extracts dependencies DESCRIPTION file. default package latest Bioconductor release inspected (behaviour can obtained using release = "release" parameter) release starting 1.8 supported, long package included said release.
code: wood_bioc_dependencies("Biobase") #> <dependencies> #>   Depends:     R (>= 2.10) #>   Depends:     BiocGenerics (>= 0.27.1) #>   Depends:     utils #>   Imports:     methods #>   Suggests:    tools #>   Suggests:    tkWidgets #>   Suggests:    ALL #>   Suggests:    RUnit #>   Suggests:    golubEsets #>   Suggests:    BiocStyle #>   Suggests:    knitr #>   Suggests:    limma wood_bioc_dependencies("Biobase", release = "2.10") #> <dependencies> #>   Depends:     R (>= 2.10) #>   Depends:     utils #>   Depends:     BiocGenerics (>= 0.1.0) #>   Imports:     methods #>   Imports:     BiocGenerics #>   Suggests:    tools #>   Suggests:    tkWidgets #>   Suggests:    ALL

title: Analysing Bioconductor
text: release parameter Bioconductor functions accepts valid Bioconductor release code, well "release" "devel" current upcoming release respectively. get list named releases (including releases 1.0 1.7, supported yet due data available) user use wood_bioc_releases().

title: Analysing base packages
text: list core packages within woodendesc framework, .e. ones shown installed.packages(priority = "base"), user use wood_core_packages().

title: Analysing base packages
text: general, core packages follow rule comes determining version codes: use version code R . Nevertheless, user wish access data anyways, woodendesc framework provides wood_core_version() function.

title: Analysing base packages
text: list package dependencies user use wood_core_dependencies(). Expect “Imports” core packages , make sense core package depend something else.
code: wood_core_dependencies("stats") #> <dependencies> #>   Imports:     utils #>   Imports:     grDevices #>   Imports:     graphics #>   Suggests:    MASS #>   Suggests:    Matrix #>   Suggests:    SuppDists #>   Suggests:    methods #>   Suggests:    stats4 #>   Enhances:    Kendall #>   Enhances:    coin #>   Enhances:    multcomp #>   Enhances:    pcaPP #>   Enhances:    pspearman #>   Enhances:    robustbase

title: Analysing CRAN
text: 20’000 packages CRAN already (numbers January 2025). list within woodendesc framework user use wood_cran_packages().
code: wood_cran_packages() |>   # There are way to many packages to simply show them all   print(max = 15) #>  [1] "A3"            "AalenJohansen" "AATtools"      "ABACUS"        #>  [5] "abasequence"   "abbreviate"    "abc"           "abc.data"      #>  [9] "ABC.RAP"       "ABCanalysis"   "abclass"       "ABCoptim"      #> [13] "abcrf"         "abcrlda"       "abctools"      #>  [ reached getOption("max.print") -- omitted 21921 entries ]

title: Analysing CRAN
text: list package versions submitted accepted CRAN user use wood_cran_versions().

title: Analysing CRAN
text: query latest package version, .e. one ’d installed calling install.packages(), user use wood_cran_latest(). returned value equivalent selecting latest version wood_cran_versions().

title: Analysing CRAN
text: list package dependencies user use wood_cran_dependencies(). function extracts dependencies DESCRIPTION file. default latest version inspected (behaviour can obtained using version = "latest" parameter) possible list dependencies previous version well.
code: wood_cran_dependencies("deepdep") #> <dependencies> #>   Depends:     R (>= 3.2.0) #>   Imports:     cranlogs #>   Imports:     httr #>   Imports:     jsonlite #>   Suggests:    BiocManager #>   Suggests:    covr #>   Suggests:    devtools #>   Suggests:    ggplot2 #>   Suggests:    ggraph #>   Suggests:    graphlayouts #>   Suggests:    igraph #>   Suggests:    knitr #>   Suggests:    miniCRAN #>   Suggests:    plyr #>   Suggests:    rmarkdown #>   Suggests:    scales #>   Suggests:    shiny #>   Suggests:    shinycssloaders #>   Suggests:    spelling #>   Suggests:    stringi #>   Suggests:    testthat (>= 2.1.0) #>   Suggests:    vcr wood_cran_dependencies("deepdep", version = "0.2.0") #> <dependencies> #>   Depends:     R (>= 3.2.0) #>   Imports:     cranlogs #>   Imports:     ggforce #>   Imports:     ggplot2 #>   Imports:     ggraph #>   Imports:     graphlayouts #>   Imports:     httr #>   Imports:     igraph #>   Imports:     jsonlite #>   Imports:     scales #>   Suggests:    BiocManager #>   Suggests:    shiny #>   Suggests:    shinycssloaders #>   Suggests:    covr #>   Suggests:    devtools #>   Suggests:    knitr #>   Suggests:    miniCRAN #>   Suggests:    plyr #>   Suggests:    rmarkdown #>   Suggests:    spelling #>   Suggests:    stringi #>   Suggests:    testthat (>= 2.1.0)

title: Analysing GitHub
text: user organization may (cases ) owner several repositories. repositories R packages, thus repository character approximated presence DESCRIPTION file, one required files R packages, root folder. default, forks repositories listed, setting can changed using include_forks parameter:

title: Analysing GitHub
text: GitHub allows referencing certain commits specifying tags associated . list tags available given repository user use wood_github_tags(). Note repositories may tags defined, case empty character vector returned.

title: Analysing GitHub
text: Repository tags follow specific guidelines version codes. extract package version codes associated GitHub tag user use wood_github_versions(). extracts data DESCRIPTION file corresponding tagged commit.

title: Analysing GitHub
text: query latest package version, .e. one ’d installed calling remotes::install_github(), user use wood_github_latest(). function queries GitHub version code associated latest commit default branch specified repository. Note commit may untagged, case returned version code may among ones listed wood_github_versions().

title: Analysing GitHub
text: list package dependencies user use wood_github_dependencies(). function extracts dependencies DESCRIPTION file. default latest commit queried (behaviour can obtained using tag = "latest" parameter) possible list dependencies tagged version.
code: wood_github_dependencies("gglgbtq", "turtletopia") #> <dependencies> #>   Depends:     R (>= 2.10) #>   Imports:     ggplot2 (>= 3.4.0) #>   Imports:     graphics #>   Imports:     grDevices #>   Imports:     rlang #>   Imports:     tibble #>   Suggests:    knitr #>   Suggests:    rmarkdown #>   Suggests:    spelling #>   Suggests:    testthat (>= 3.0.0) #>   Suggests:    vdiffr wood_github_dependencies("versionsort", "turtletopia", tag = "v1.0.0") #> <dependencies> #>   Suggests:    covr #>   Suggests:    spelling #>   Suggests:    testthat (>= 3.0.0)

title: Analysing GitLab
text: user group may (cases ) owner several repositories. repositories R packages, thus repository character approximated presence DESCRIPTION file, one required files R packages, root folder. default, forks repositories listed, setting can changed using include_forks parameter:

title: Analysing GitLab
text: GitLab allows referencing certain commits specifying tags associated . list tags available given repository user use wood_gitlab_tags(). Note repositories may tags defined, case empty character vector returned.

title: Analysing GitLab
text: Repository tags follow specific guidelines version codes. extract package version codes associated GitLab tag user use wood_gitlab_versions(). extracts data DESCRIPTION file corresponding tagged commit.

title: Analysing GitLab
text: query latest package version, .e. one ’d installed calling remotes::install_gitlab(), user use wood_gitlab_latest(). function queries GitLab version code associated latest commit default branch specified repository. Note commit may untagged, case returned version code may among ones listed wood_gitlab_versions().

text: list package dependencies user use wood_gitlab_dependencies(). function extracts dependencies DESCRIPTION file. default latest commit queried (behaviour can obtained using tag = "latest" parameter) possible list dependencies tagged version.

text: list versions package installed selected libraries user use wood_local_versions(). Note “versions” plural, possible install one version package, different library.

text: list package dependencies user use wood_local_dependencies(). Hopefully Imports installed !

text: universe separate package list, user specify relevant universe universe parameter.

text: Since R-universe works pointing latest commit main branch, ’s always one version package; extract user use wood_runiverse_version().

text: structure PACKAGES file allows one version stored, wood_url_version() may return one version.

what: Find Packages and Their Dependencies in Any R Repository
title: Find Packages and Their Dependencies in Any R Repository
text: {woodendesc} strives provide unified API query R repository following data: list available packages, version code selected package, direct dependencies selected package. package tries cache much possible reuse existing cache wherever possible minimize internet usage. Many repositories (CRAN, Bioconductor, R-universe, local libraries) custom implementations handlers make use additional possibilities present (e.g. previous versions CRAN old releases Bioconductor).

title: Find Packages and Their Dependencies in Any R Repository
code: # Install from CRAN install.packages("woodendesc") # Install the development version from GitHub: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("turtletopia/woodendesc")

title: Find Packages and Their Dependencies in Any R Repository
text: repository dedicated functions listing available packages, package version, package dependencies. list available packages returned character vector. example call returning list CRAN packages: available package version returned single code. example call checking current version Biobase package Bioconductor: Dependencies package returned data frame set columns calls. example call locally installed digest package (dependency woodendesc): Note repositories store just one version package (e.g. CRAN Github). cases can distinguished pluralized _versions function name component return version codes instead; character vector length. works gglgbtq Github: single version code needed, ’s counterpart selects latest version . current version aurrera Github : Last, least, three functions searching multiple repositories collecting results. Read documentation details specify repos parameter. wood_packages() collects available packages specified repositories returns unique elements: wood_versions() returns package versions available least one specified repositories; may take one package: wood_dependencies() returns list package dependencies, data frame package specified; first working repository used package, dependencies supposed summable: ever need clear cache, simply call:
code: library(woodendesc) # Too many packages to list them all all_cran_pkgs <- wood_cran_packages() print(all_cran_pkgs, max = 10) #>  [1] "A3"            "AalenJohansen" "AATtools"      "ABACUS"        #>  [5] "abasequence"   "abbreviate"    "abc"           "abc.data"      #>  [9] "ABC.RAP"       "ABCanalysis"   #>  [ reached getOption("max.print") -- omitted 21946 entries ] wood_bioc_version("Biobase") #> [1] "2.58.0" wood_local_dependencies("digest") #> <dependencies> #>   Depends:     R (>= 3.3.0) #>   Imports:     utils #>   Suggests:    tinytest #>   Suggests:    simplermarkdown wood_github_versions("gglgbtq", "turtletopia") #> [1] "0.1.1" "0.1.0" wood_github_latest("aurrera", "turtletopia") #> [1] "0.1.0" wood_packages(repos = c("core", "https://colinfay.me")) #>  [1] "attempt"        "base"           "compiler"       "craneur"        #>  [5] "datasets"       "devaddins"      "dockerfiler"    "fryingpane"     #>  [9] "graphics"       "grDevices"      "grid"           "jekyllthat"     #> [13] "languagelayeR"  "methods"        "parallel"       "proustr"        #> [17] "rgeoapi"        "rpinterest"     "splines"        "stats"          #> [21] "stats4"         "tcltk"          "tidystringdist" "tools"          #> [25] "utils" wood_versions(   c("aurrera", "woodendesc"),   repos = c("local#all", "runiverse@turtletopia", "cran") ) #> $aurrera #> [1] "0.1.0" #>  #> $woodendesc #> [1] "0.1.0" wood_dependencies(   c("versionsort", "gglgbtq"),   repos = c("local#all", "runiverse@turtletopia", "cran") ) #> <woodendesc dependency list [2]> #>  <versionsort dependencies> #>   Suggests:    covr #>   Suggests:    spelling #>   Suggests:    testthat (>= 3.0.0) #>  #>  <gglgbtq dependencies> #>   Imports:     ggplot2 #>   Imports:     graphics #>   Imports:     grDevices #>   Suggests:    knitr #>   Suggests:    rmarkdown #>   Suggests:    spelling #>   Suggests:    testthat (>= 3.0.0) wood_clear_cache()

title: Filter dependencies by type — filter_dependencies
text: object wood_deps() || wood_dep_list() Dependencies filter. character() vector listing types dependencies, subset c("Depends", "Imports", "LinkingTo", "Suggests", "Enhances"). Character string "" shorthand vector, character string ""vector without "Enhances", character string "strong" (default) first three elements vector. convention tools::package_dependencies().

title: Collect all package versions from multiple repositories — wood_versions
Collect all package versions from multiple repositories — wood_versions
text: packages character() Names packages query . repos character() vector repositories query. following values available: "cran", meaning CRAN; "bioc@release", meaning Bioconductor, release replaced valid Bioconductor release code one "release", "devel"; "runiverse@universe", meaning R-universe, universe replaced valid universe name (e.g. turtletopia); "github/user", meaning GitHub, user replaced valid user organization name (e.g. turtletopia); "gitlab/user", meaning GitLab, user replaced valid user group name (e.g. r-packages); "local#index", meaning local library, index replaced integer index library base::.libPaths() keyword; "core", meaning base R packages; URL none matched.

text: list named queried packages, element character vector version codes.

woodendesc 0.2.1
text: Fixed GitLab missing option wood_packages(), wood_dependencies(), wood_versions(). Modified tests avoid storing whole CRAN package list twice.

title: woodendesc 0.2.0
text: Reimplemented code, replacing {httr} {httr2}. Updated code reflect API changes Bioconductor R-universe. Added support GitLab. Bioconductor data releases 1.5-1.7 longer available. Dropped support older R versions (< 4.1.0) increased maintenance complexity significantly.

title: woodendesc 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-04-18 Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
